datafield.subfield: Department of Industrial and Operations Engineering.
Department of Industrial and Operations Engineering (University of Michigan) records,

Department in the College of Engineering at the University of Michigan. The Department was started at the University of Michigan in 1956 because of the increasing importance of mathematical modeling and computers in manufacturing. The department began by offering curriculum focused on human performance, the economics of engineering, facility planning, and quality control. The department has become even more involved due to its increasing use of computers and mathematical modeling. As of 2013, the department moved its operations and is currently located on North Campus. The Department of Industrial and Operations Engineering at the University of Michigan is internationally regarded and one of the United States' top programs in the field.

Includes brochures and pamphlets, graduate study bulletins, directories, manuals, departmental review reports, and yearbooks. Also includes publications from the Center for Occupational Health and Safety Engineering, and the Engineering Human performance and Safety Laboratory. Also includes the publication IOE Alumni Newsletter, as well as the student publications The Rag and Industrial Blueprint.

The chronological files are the correspondence and other handouts from the various administrators and faculty members in the department. These typically cover the projects of the department as well as some of problems faced by the staff. The collection also contains minutes for some of the committees such as the graduate, Ph.D., Steering Review, and others. These records document the problems, solutions, and discussion of the department as a whole, as well as student finances and Ph.D. candidates. The large majority of the collection is made up of binders of the agendas of various presentations. These presentations covered business interactions with companies in Japan, China, and Asia as a whole. These topics were presented by the IOE, with the help of some of the other departments on campus.
Finding aid available via the World Wide web at URL: http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/f/findaid/findaid-idx?c=bhlead&idno=umich-bhl-9716
